etymons.meaning: to flow with force; to be superfluous; to overflow; to slip away

Preterit Intransitive.turoyo: 1) azzelešafəʕ 87; 58/156; məd-šafəʕak=kefekom-anəkbaṭəlaqqa d-u=ḥəs-awo, ṣafimede lo=fayəš 58/68; nafəl mine dozdān d-ak=kallat-ayḏe l-i=arʕo, w-hiyeazzéšapəʕ 87; 55/7; 69/275, 287; šapəʕnohayo, maṭino l-i=qriṯoḥreto ‘LB 218; rawəxaʕmi w-žboyidiḏihiyešapəʕlə-Nṣiwən; čiktaḥt i=trela d-ak=kefe w-šapəʕnoaʕlei=saʕa d-a=ḥḏaḥṣar w-falge, falge=d-yawmo, aṯi u=šulṭono w-aw=wazir-ayḏeaʕme w-šapiʕi b-u=šuq-awo-da
translations: ‘He got under the trailer with stones, and I ran him over’ EL 16;

Infectum.turoyo: 1) g-šofəʕ 99; 66/125; yawmo m-ay=yawmoṯe d-aloho, ko-šopəʕkarwan m-ani Nawar Qarač 99; 87/7; i=taqsiyemhalaxla b-qamuṯan w gāh g-šəpʕina-la LB 21;

Part. act..turoyo: 1) l-u=šapoʕo l-u=azolo l-u=aṯoyo, k-oxəlšoteqoyəm w əzzeyo b-darbe 121; 77/221;

Preterit.turoyo: hano u=samy-awomašapʕilehani 141; 73/89; ʕəmranhawxamašpaʕlanhōl d-ʕəmranhawiḥamšaḥṣar=əšnemballe l-u=doqtōr, l-Marde. me-Marde mašpaʕʕe l-Dyārbắkər
translations: ‘We (I) spent our (my) life in that manner until we (I) became fifteen years old (lit ‘until our (my) age became fifteen years old’)’ EL 5;
‘They brought him to a doctor, to Mardin. And from Mardin they moved him further to Diyarbakir’ EL 19;

Infectum.turoyo: lə=g-mašfaʕnal-le d-lo qṭolo 148; 61/225; ko-mašpəʕḥayebasime 143; bayn a=ʕrawnoy-ani mašpaʕʕal-li LB 45;
